business.headline: DNPA hosts key AI and journalism dialogue at IndiaAI Impact Summit 2026The session brought together senior leaders from India's most influential news organisations along with global publishing representation to examine how artificial intelligence is transforming journalism, and how India must shape that transformation responsibly.
Draft income tax rules 2026 could change your tax forms: What it means for you?Under the draft new law, statutory forms such as Form 26AS, Form 16 and Form 13 will be issued with new numbers.

Sensex, Nifty close higher as IT and PSU banking stocks rally; Infosys up 2%The IT sector played a key role in lifting the markets. The Nifty IT index, which is the second-heaviest sector on the benchmarks, climbed 1%. Shares of Infosys rose 1.9% after the company announced a partnership with US-based artificial intelligence firm Anthropic.

Are millennials and Gen Z behind 90–95% of India's home purchases?For many borrowers under 40, applying for a home loan online is no longer optional, it is the preferred way. Around 72% of borrowers in this age group choose digital applications, and nearly half of borrowers above 60 are also getting comfortable with online processes.

Cochin Shipyard, HAL, BEL: Are defence stocks set for a strong comeback?The defence theme is back on screens. Now it needs breadth, sustained volumes and follow-through to turn early strength into a lasting rally.

Adani Group announces $100 billion to build AI-ready, green data centres by 2035The $100 billion direct investment is expected to catalyse an additional $150 billion across related sectors over the next decade. These include server manufacturing, advanced electrical infrastructure, sovereign cloud platforms, and semiconductor and compute ecosystems.

Star Health rejects Lucknow man's viral allegation over mother's claim rejectionIn a post, the man said he had been paying around Rs 50,000 every year as premium for his mother's health insurance policy. When she fell ill, he went to the Lucknow office of Star Health and Allied Insurance to seek claim support.

Gold drops over Rs 2,500, silver falls Rs 6,000: Are bigger price cuts on the way?Gold and silver have taken a sharp hit, shaking confidence after weeks of strong gains. As volatility rises, investors are trying to understand whether this decline signals a larger trend shift.

Changed your salary account? Here's what happens to your PF withdrawals nowUpdating your account when there is no urgency is far easier than scrambling to fix it when you need funds quickly. Think of it as preventive maintenance for your finances.

Infosys, TCS, HCLTech gain up to 3%: Why are IT stocks rising today?The main trigger for the rally was Infosys announcing a strategic partnership with artificial intelligence firm Anthropic. Investors reacted positively to the news, pushing Infosys shares nearly 3% higher to around Rs 1,407 during the session.

Infosys shares jump 3% today after announcing partnership with AnthropicThis new partnership will help companies in tough, rule-heavy sectors use AI better, and improve efficiency in providing essential services to the public.
Sensex, Nifty open lower but IT stocks rallyThe S&P BSE added 42.49 points to 83,319.64, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 17.05 points to 25,665.70 as of 10:10 am.

Global tech giants see billions erased amid rising AI cost concernsInvestors who once rewarded bold AI plans are now asking tougher questions about spending, profits and competition. Several of the largest US technology firms have lost hundreds of billions of dollars in market value since the start of 2026.

India–US trade deal advances with focus on finalising legal agreementSpeaking on the development, Commerce Secretary Rajesh Agrawal said a joint statement outlining the contours of the agreement has already been signed. He said that these contours now need to be converted into a formal legal agreement.

Record MSP procurement: How many farmers are actually benefiting?India's MSP system is clearly expanding, with higher spending, larger procurement and more beneficiaries than before. Yet the debate has shifted from scale to security.
Sensex rallies over 600 points: Why stock market rose today?The S&P BSE Sensex rallied 650.39 points to close at 83,277.15, while the NSE Nifty50 added 211.65 points to end at 25,682.75.

How cash levels in mutual funds impact returns during volatile marketsIn the current market, volatility caused by global and external factors has led some mutual funds to increase their cash positions. The idea is to lower risk and protect portfolios from sudden corrections.

Can NPS help you save tax in the new regime? What salaried employees must knowFor salaried workers who have moved to the new tax regime, tax saving can feel limited. This has led many to question if there are still practical ways to ease their tax burden. Let's have a look.

Can your employer refuse gratuity if you get pension? Here's what employees must knowMany employees assume that receiving a pension from their employer means they may have to give up gratuity. But the law draws a clear distinction between the two. A recent court ruling has clarified what workers should know about their rights.

Why Mumbai remains India's top luxury housing hubThe global recognition Mumbai is receiving today is best understood as validation rather than arrival. International research now ranks the city among the world's fastest-growing luxury housing markets, reflecting sustained price appreciation at the very top end.

entertainment.headline: Sidharth Malhotra's father Sunil Malhotra dies; actor in Delhi with family Actor Sidharth Malhotra's father, Sunil Malhotra, died on Saturday, 14 February, in Delhi after a prolonged illness.

Anubhav Sinha on Ra.One 2 hopes and SRK's availability: It's a 3-year marriage Anubhav Sinha expressed his desire to develop a sequel to Ra.One, describing the ambitious project as a "three-year marriage." He mentioned that the sequel's future depends on his own schedule and Shah Rukh Khan's availability for such a long-term commitment.

Heated Rivalry director Jacob Tierney stays true to source material. Here's why Filmmaker Jacob Tierney says he refused to alter the Heated Rivalry novel while adapting it for television. Here's why his approach stands out.

Alia Bhatt joins Cillian Murphy and Kate Hudson as BAFTA 2026 presenter Actor Alia Bhatt has been named among a high-profile list of presenters for the 2026 BAFTA Awards. She will be joining Cillian Murphy, Kate Hudson, and Glenn Close for the ceremony on February 22.

Kiran Rao is down with chikungunya, meet her 'excellent paramedic' Filmmaker Kiran Rao recently shared her experience with chikungunya on social media. She emphasised the importance of taking health precautions and expressed gratitude for the support she received during her recovery.

Actor Farida Jalal says her comeback outshone her early career Veteran actor Farida Jalal discusses her approach to work, the significance of her comeback, and observations on the changing nature of fame and roles in the industry.

Varun Grover on teen accused in hit-and-run case: Politicians in Papa's pockets Varun Grover slammed the "soft-oligarchy" following the Dwarka hit-and-run, where a minor accused of killing Sahil Dhaneshra received interim bail. He criticised the culture of influential families escaping accountability, highlighting how systemic gaps allow reckless behavior to go unpunished in high-profile cases.

Alongside legends: Emmanuel Macron meets Manoj Bajpayee, Anil Kapoor and others French President Emmanuel Macron met Bollywood celebrities including Shabana Azmi, Anil Kapoor, Manoj Bajpayee, Zoya Akhtar and Richa Chadha in Mumbai during his India visit. "Alongside legends of Indian cinema," Macron wrote in the caption along with pictures he posted.

Amul celebrates Farhan's Ravi Shankar act in The Beatles with quirky topical Amul India has celebrated Farhan Akhtar's Hollywood debut as Ravi Shankar with a witty topical. Here's why the casting is making waves.

Salim Khan shifted to ICU, doctors confirm he is stable Salman Khan's father, Salim Khan, has been shifted to the Intensive Care Unit (ICU) of Lilavati Hospital under the observation of experts. The doctor, in a press statement, said that Khan is currently stable.

Rajpal Yadav expresses gratitude to High Court following interim bail from Tihar Rajpal Yadav expressed gratitude to the High Court as well as the film industry and his fans after being granted interim bail. Addressing a cheque bounce case, the actor mentioned he remains ready to answer all allegations and thanked the judiciary for the relief.

Why were Akshay Kumar's parents denied entry to his first show? Actor shares During an episode of Wheel of Fortune, Akshay Kumar recalled how his parents were unable to attend his first stage performance in Punjab. The actor also shared that the security staff thought that his father was intoxicated.

Rollercoaster gone rogue: Shanaya recalls Aryan Khan's prank on her and Suhana Actor Shanaya Kapoor shared a childhood memory where she and Suhana Khan were pushed down the stairs by Aryan Khan. The confession came as she was promoting her latest film, Tu Yaa Main, alongside co-star Adarsh Gourav.

Dia Mirza says storytelling can encourage climate action and change Bollywood actor Dia Mirza combined climate urgency with cultural wisdom in her Harvard keynote. What powerful message did she leave students with?

Rashmika Mandanna, Vijay Deverakonda's slow-burn love story heads to the altar Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda are set to marry on February 26 in an intimate ceremony. From their first film together in 2018 to years of speculation, their slow-burn romance has shaped away from the spotlight.

I am a Shiva devotee: Prakash Raj reveals his character in Rajamouli's Varanasi Prakash Raj confirms his role in SS Rajamouli's mythological film, Varanasi. The actor adds star power to the film, which features Mahesh Babu, Priyanka Chopra and Prithviraj Sukumaran in lead roles.

Sunny Deol's Gabru set for May release following Border 2 success. Check date here Sunny Deol's next film, Gabru, is set for theatrical release on May 8, following the recent success of Border 2. Directed by Shashank Udapurkar, the movie features themes of courage, identity, and resilience.

Adarsh Gourav urges viewers to back Tu Yaa Main: We're off to a slow start Admitting Tu Yaa Main has had a slow start, actor Adarsh Gourav on Tuesday urged audiences to watch the film in theatres. He also stressed the need to support smaller commercial films.

AR Rahman takes 40-day digital break before Ramayana event: Report Singer AR Rahman has stepped away from social media for 40 days as a major Ramayana milestone approaches. What's behind the sudden digital silence?

general news.headline: Warm welcome awaits you: PM Modi's India invite to Bangladesh's Tarique RahmanIn a letter to Tarique Rahman following the Bangladesh Nationalist Party's (BNP) electoral win and inauguration of government, PM Modi expressed confidence in strengthening bilateral ties with the neighbouring country.

Will AI take away jobs? PM Modi addresses biggest concern among youthPrime Minister Narendra Modi has addressed the biggest fear among India's youth: whether AI will take away jobs. Here's what he said.

Ex-Assam Congress chief Bhupen Borah to join BJP on Feb 22: Himanta SarmaAssam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma announced that former Assam Congress chief Bhupen Borah will join the BJP on February 22, along with several other Congress leaders.

India to turn off Ravi water tap for Pakistan ahead of summerWater woes for Pakistan are unlikely to end soon. Ahead of a harsh summer, India is now set to block surplus water flow from the Ravi River to Pakistan with the completion of the Shahpur Kandi barrage. How will it impact Pakistan? Read on to find out.

Tarique Rahman becomes PM, but is Yunus the real winner in Bangladesh?As BNP's Tarique Rahman takes oath today, Muhammad Yunus has emerged as the biggest winner in Bangladesh. He pulled off most things he set out to do in the last 18 months and conducted an election by barring his bete noire, Sheikh Hasina's Awami League, from it. How did an 85-year-old Yunus manage to get things done his way?

India Today Group unveils Sutra, an AI news-anchor, at India AI Impact SummitThe India Today Group has unveiled Sutra, an AI-assisted anchor, in partnership with BharatGen. The AI anchor has been deployed to provide contextual and relevant news from the India AI Impact Summit.

Iran signals progress in talks with US after live-fire drill, Khamenei's warningThe missiles launched from within Iran and along its coast struck targets in the Strait of Hormuz during drills. Authorities also announced temporary closure of parts of the waterway for safety during live-fire exercises.

Only Hindu minister in Tarique Rahman Cabinet. Who is Nitai Roy Chowdhury?Nitai Roy Chowdhury, a veteran BNP leader, is the only Hindu to be included in Prime Minister Tarique Rahman's Cabinet. A vocal critic of the Awami League, he had earlier blamed the Sheikh Hasina-led party for oppression of Hindus in Bangladesh.

US envoy's first Bengaluru visit with Tejasvi Surya features dosa, coffee and auto rideUS Ambassador Sergio Gor's first visit to Bengaluru included local experiences with BJP MP Tejasvi Surya and discussions on strengthening India-US ties in trade and technology.

Australia out, Zimbabwe reach Super 8 stage after Pallekele washoutT20 World Cup, IRE vs ZIM: Australia have been knocked out of the competition after the clash between Ireland and Zimbabwe in Pallekele on Tuesday was abandoned due to rain. The abandoned fixture sealed Zimbabwe's qualification for the Super 8 stage alongside Sri Lanka from Group B.

Indore man killed girlfriend, abused corpse, searched YouTube to speak to spiritThe man who murdered his girlfriend in Indore admitted to violating her corpse afterwards. He later searched on YouTube for ways to communicate with spirits.

From defence to innovation, PM, Macron launch new chapter in India-France tiesFrench President Emmanuel Macron is on a three-day visit to India to attend the AI Summit 2026 in New Delhi and to hold high-level discussions with the Indian leadership.

Alongside legends: Emmanuel Macron meets Manoj Bajpayee, Anil Kapoor and othersFrench President Emmanuel Macron met Bollywood celebrities including Shabana Azmi, Anil Kapoor, Manoj Bajpayee, Zoya Akhtar and Richa Chadha in Mumbai during his India visit. "Alongside legends of Indian cinema," Macron wrote in the caption along with pictures he posted.

CBSE Board Exam 2026 Live: NCERT, Algebra and Geometry in focus in Class 10 Maths paperThe CBSE Board Exams 2026 have officially commenced today for Class 10 and Class 12, with more than 43 lakh students appearing across examination centres nationwide. Exams are being held in a single shift from 10:30 am to 1:30 pm, so timely arrival at centres is crucial. Get complete exam day guidelines, last-minute preparation tips, dress code rules, and all essential updates to ensure a smooth and stress-free exam experience. Stay tuned for the latest news and live updates from the CBSE Board Exams 2026.

Haldiram's Hyderabad outlet under lens for selling 'expired, unlabelled' food itemsThe issue reportedly came to light when visitors observed that several sweets and packaged food products lacked visible manufacturing and expiry details.

No rest for Bumrah: India want valuable Ahmedabad experience before Super 8T20 World Cup: India will not be resting Jasprit Bumrah and Abhishek Sharma in their match against the Netherlands, said batting coach Sitanshu Kotak. India are playing their last group-stage game in Ahmedabad.

Diners are paying Rs 26,000 to get chocolate poured on their hands, but why?Imagine walking into a Michelin-starred restaurant in your fanciest outfit, ready to document every dish, only to be asked to wash your hands with chocolate.

Western disturbance to bring early rain, thunderstorms on WednesdayWeather activity may also extend into western Uttar Pradesh, with rainfall chances from Meerut to Lucknow and Bahraich, and possible showers in Agra, Kanpur, Mathura, Jhansi, and Lalitpur.

Not charity, but a right: Andhra High Court upholds maintenance to estranged wifeThe Andhra Pradesh High Court upheld a family court order granting maintenance to an estranged wife and her minor son, stressing that maintenance is a legal right, not charity.

Video shows SUV ramming Delhi biker head-on, mother says teen was filming reelsThe mother of a 23-year-old man who died in a road accident last week has released a video, claiming it captures the exact moment an SUV, driven by a 17-year-old, hit her son.

300/300 in JEE Main: Hardware shop owner's son from Gaya gets perfect 100 percentileShubham Kumar, the son of a small hardware shop owner from Gaya, Bihar, has scored a perfect 300 out of 300 and 100 percentile in JEE Main 2026, emerging as the Bihar topper and All India Rank 3. Raised in a modest household in the Brahmani Ghat locality, Shubham's journey proves that determination and discipline matter more than privilege.

Minister apologises for AI Summit Day 1 issues, promises smoother experienceUnion Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw apologised for the issues witnessed on the opening day of the India AI Impact Summit 2026, calling the turnout "phenomenal". He said the government is committed to addressing concerns to ensure a smoother experience for attendees.

Why US envoy's rare Army command visit near Pakistan border sparked buzzA routine visit by the US envoy and the US Indo-Pacific commander to the Indian Army's Western Command near the Pakistan border has generated considerable buzz. This is the first such high-profile visit after Operation Sindoor. But, behind the optics, lies a broader message.

NGT clears path for India's Hong Kong. What's the Great Nicobar Project?The National Green Tribunal (NGT) has refused to interfere with the environmental clearance for the Rs 81,000-crore Great Nicobar Project. This effectively removes a major legal hurdle and allows the mega strategic plan to move forward. Here's what you need to know about India's most ambitious island infrastructure push that aims to challenge Chinese assertion in the Indo-Pacific.

sports.headline: Royals seek waiver from state govt to host IPL in Jaipur after safety concerns Rajasthan Royals are racing to get their home ground ready for the Indian Premier League and have sought an indemnity waiver from the state government to host matches in Jaipur. The request follows concerns over the venue's readiness raised by an independent auditor and the Board of Control for Cricket in India.

No need to overanalyse Abhishek Sharma's duck against Pakistan: Sitanshu Kotak T20 World Cup, IND vs NED: India batting coach Sitanshu Kotak said that there was no need to overanalyse Abhishek Sharma's form in the tournament. Abhishek came back into the line-up after recovering from illness, but got out for a duck against Pakistan.

Devdutt Padikkal charges towards India spot as Karnataka inch closer to Ranji final Devdutt Padikkal scored a career-best 232 to help Karnataka to a mammoth total in the Ranji Trophy semi-finals. Should Indian selectors consider him for the No.3 Test spot?

IND vs NED Predicted XI: Will Arshdeep Singh replace Kuldeep Yadav? T20 World Cup, IND vs NED: Suryakumar Yadav's India have qualified for the Super 8 and are favourites to finish at the top of their group. One potential change could be bringing Arshdeep Singh back in place of Kuldeep Yadav.

Cricket Australia plan to host one BBL game in India, TNCA confirms discussions Cricket Australia is exploring the possibility of staging a Big Bash League match in India next season as part of a broader strategy to tap into the country's vast and lucrative cricket market, according to a report by Sen Cricket.

No rest for Bumrah: India want valuable Ahmedabad experience before Super 8 T20 World Cup: India will not be resting Jasprit Bumrah and Abhishek Sharma in their match against the Netherlands, said batting coach Sitanshu Kotak. India are playing their last group-stage game in Ahmedabad.

Netherlands urge more bilateral cricket for associates after strong T20 WC show Netherlands captain Scott Edwards said that a string of impressive performances from associate nations in the T20 World Cup should pave the way for more bilateral cricket against Test-playing countries.

Auqib Nabi outshines Bengal's Mohammed Shami as J&K close in on maiden final Auqib Nabi claimed a nine-wicket match haul to outshine Mohammed Shami and push Jammu and Kashmir to the brink of a maiden Ranji Trophy final after Bengal were bowled out for 99 on day three.

Sikandar Raza revels in emotional celebration with fans after Zimbabwe's Super 8 berth T20 World Cup, IRE vs ZIM: Sikandar Raza and his Zimbabwean teammates celebrated with passionate fans after securing a Super 8 spot. Following the match, Raza thanked the supporters and pledged to keep Zimbabwe's flag flying high.

Scotland vs Nepal Live Score T20 World Cup 2026 updates from Mumbai Scotland (SCO) vs Nepal (NEP) Live Score, T20 World Cup: Nepal have won the toss and opted to bowl first at the Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai. Both teams have been knocked out of the competition and will be looking to finish their campaign on a positive note.

Australia out, Zimbabwe reach Super 8 stage after Pallekele washout T20 World Cup, IRE vs ZIM: Australia have been knocked out of the competition after the clash between Ireland and Zimbabwe in Pallekele on Tuesday was abandoned due to rain. The abandoned fixture sealed Zimbabwe's qualification for the Super 8 stage alongside Sri Lanka from Group B.

IND-PAK conflict could force future World Cup out of India: ReportT20 World Cup: The geopolitical conflict between India and Pakistan might force future ICC tournaments outside the subcontinent, Australian media reported on February 16. As per the report, Australia could be the favoured destination.

Lone female on grid,  F1 aspirant Atiqa Mir climbs higher on WSK ladderIndian racing prodigy Atiqa has shown skill and maturity beyond her years after making a voluntary switch from the Mini to the far more demanding Junior category, producing standout performances in the early part of her 2026 international karting season.

IRE vs ZIM highlights : Australia out, Zimbabwe reach Super 8 after washoutIreland (IRE) vs Zimbabwe (ZIM) Highlights, T20 World Cup: The Group clash between Ireland cricket team and Zimbabwe cricket team in Pallekele was washed out due to heavy rain. The shared point confirmed Zimbabwe's place in the Super 8 and knocked out Ireland and 2021 champions Australia national cricket team from the tournament.

New Zealand storm into Super 8s, knock Afghanistan out of T20 World CupT20 World Cup: New Zealand stormed into the Super 8s with an eight-wicket win over Canada in Chennai. Glen Phillips and Rachin Ravindra's chase ended Afghanistan's campaign despite Yuvraj Samra's record-breaking century.

Pratika Rawal added to ODI squad for Australia tour after long injury lay offStar batter Pratika Rawal has been added to India's ODI squad after recovering from an ankle injury. India are set to take on Australia in a three-match ODI series beginning on February 24.

Treat Imran Khan fairly: Kapil, Gavaskar join 14 captains in appeal to Pak govtFormer India captains Kapil Dev and Sunil Gavaskar have joined a rare global cricketing appeal seeking better treatment for Imran Khan, the former Pakistan Prime Minister and 1992 World Cup-winning captain, who remains in jail amid growing health concerns.

FIH Pro League: Hardik Singh to lead India in Hobart leg; Harmanpreet ruled outMidfielder Hardik Singh was named captain of the embattled Indian men's hockey team for its FIH Pro League matches in Hobart from February 20 to 25 after regular skipper Harmanpreet Singh opted out due to "personal reasons."

Canada's Yuvraj Samra becomes youngest centurion in T20 World Cup historyCanada opener Yuvraj Samra became the youngest centurion in men's T20 World Cup history during Canada's clash against New Zealand at the M. A. Chidambaram Stadium.

Shami scalps 8 wickets in Ranji semis, puts India selectors on high alertMohammed Shami put India selectors on alert with an eight-wicket haul for Bengal in the Ranji Trophy semi-final against Jammu & Kashmir. The veteran pacer now has 38 wickets this season.

Ian Healy slams Australia's selection calls after defeat vs Sri LankaAUS vs SL, T20 World Cup: Former Australia wicketkeeper Ian Healy has strongly criticised the team's selection after a heavy defeat to Sri Lanka. Australia now face an uphill battle to qualify for the Super 8 with their final group match against Oman.

Gambhir to join Rajasthan Royals? IPL franchise approach India coachRajasthan Royals have approached India head coach Gautam Gambhir for a senior role in their setup amid an ownership change. However, Gambhir is unlikely to accept due to conflict-of-interest rules and national commitments.

Abhishek Sharma, just take a single first: Gavaskar's advice to India openerT20 World Cup: Sunil Gavaskar offered simple advice to Abhishek Sharma amid his tough start to the T20 World Cup. The former captain urged him to get off the mark first before unleashing his attacking game.

Did Pakistan players wait to shake hands with India after Colombo defeat?India defeated Pakistan by 61 runs in the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2026 fixture. The Men in Blue maintained their no handshake policy against the arch-rivals.

Shoaib Akhtar's rapid U-turn: Mohsin Naqvi incompetent to good man in 24 hoursT20 World Cup: Shoaib Akhtar made a quick U-turn on his criticism of PCB chief Mohsin Naqvi after Pakistan's humiliating loss to India. Akhtar said his "incompetent" remark was twisted and Naqvi is "a good guy."

Smriti Mandhana named Indian sportswoman of the yearSmriti Mandhana was named BBC Indian Sportswoman of the Year after a standout 2025 season. The opener starred in India's Women's World Cup triumph and also won another WPL title with RCB.

Jose Mourinho's Benfica not banking on miracles against a wounded Real MadridJose Mourinho says Real Madrid are a wounded king ahead of their Champions League clash with Benfica and insists his side need near perfection, not a miracle, to advance.

How Sri Lanka learned from Australia's mistakes to secure Super 8 spotT20 World Cup 2026: Pathum Nissanka said Sri Lanka knew Australia were 20 runs short, planned a calm 12-over approach and executed perfectly to seal an eight-wicket win and Super 8 spot.

How can Australia seal Super 8 spot after shock Sri Lanka defeat?T20 World Cup 2026: Australia's Super 8 hopes hang by a thread after Sri Lanka's win, with Mitchell Marsh admitting they now need "the luck of the Irish" to stay alive.

How 2 ex-India coaches planned Australia's downfall in T20 World CupSri Lanka vs Australia: Co-hosts Sri Lanka qualified for the Super 8s by beating Australia in Pallekele. After the game, head coach Sanath Jayasuriya explained how two Indian coaches helped him shape this Sri Lankan side.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
